newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat settled lower on harvest pressure.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat settled lower on harvest pressure.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures settled lower, and traders said pressure came amid forecasts for mainly dry weather in the southern U.S. Plains that should allow harvest to move ahead rapidly.
"The midday forecasts came out and called for less rain in harvest areas Monday and Tuesday," a KCBT trader said.
KCBT wheat had rallied off its lows into positive territory on support from CBOT soybeans, which hit their upper trading limit on concern over tight stocks.
But wheat faded at the midsession as soybeans fell back from their intraday highs.
KCBT wheat settled 3-1/2 to eight cents lower, with July down 3-1/2 cents at $3.73 per bushel.
Traders said Prudential sold 1.5 million July bushels and one million September. Continental Grain sold close to two million July.
